[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Libra Scheduler defines requirements for optimizing job scheduling, resource allocation, and workload management in HPC environments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Libra enables task prioritization, resource tracking, and efficient workload distribution, integrating with HPC clusters and authentication services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Libra manages job execution, resource usage tracking, and queue prioritization.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Libra integrates with HPC cluster tools, resource monitors, and authentication systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Libra provides web-based and CLI interfaces for job submission and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Libra operates on distributed clusters and high-speed storage nodes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Libra supports APIs for third-party integrations and custom scheduling algorithms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Libra ensures secure data exchange via SSH and HTTPS protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Libra optimizes memory for efficient job queue management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Libra operates continuously with scheduled updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Libra configures to different cluster setups and workloads.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Libra integrates with analytics tools for resource tracking and performance insights.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for HPC users, administrators, and resource managers with basic technical knowledge.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Libra depends on stable cluster infrastructure and compatible middleware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Libra requires operational compute nodes, storage, and network infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Job: Task submitted to HPC cluster.
Queue: List of jobs awaiting execution.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with cluster monitoring tools to collect, analyze, and provide real-time resource updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to user authentication services to ensure secure and verified job submissions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process job submissions within 2 seconds under normal workload conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall handle up to 10,000 concurrent jobs.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall prioritize job scheduling based on resource availability (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide resource utilization reports for administrators (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall provide intuitive job submission forms, detailed status tracking, and interactive monitoring dashboards.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual functionality.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall store job queue information securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time queries for resource utilization and availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modular architecture principles.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with ISO 27001 standards for data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with HPC data exchange protocols and meet GDPR requirements for user data privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically during peak workloads, ensuring optimal resource allocation.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical actions such as job execution, resource allocation, user activity, and security events for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates scheduling, monitoring, and HPC compliance through testing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, setup guides, and API documentation.
